name: SnoozeIncident
description:
Temporarily suspend alerts for an incident.

Use this tool to pause notifications for a specific incident, allowing you to manage alerts more effectively. Ideal for situations where immediate attention isn't required.

parameters.name: incident_id
parameters.description: The unique ID of the incident to snooze.

parameters.name: api_version_header
parameters.description: Specifies the version of the API to use, formatted as a string. Required for versioning.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

parameters.name: content_type_header
parameters.description: Specify the content type for the request. Defaults to 'application/json'.

parameters.name: user_email
parameters.description: The email address of a valid user associated with the account making the request.

value_schema.description: The email address of a valid user associated with the account making the request.

parameters.name: snooze_duration_seconds
parameters.description: The number of seconds to pause the incident alerts. After this period, the incident will go back to the 'triggered' state.

duration.description: The number of seconds to snooze the incident for. After this number of seconds has elapsed, the incident will return to the "triggered" state.
